alert.note: Alert for Eastern Clinton; Northern Franklin; Southern Franklin; Western Clinton (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 4:33PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Clinton and northeastern Franklin Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 433 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Bryants Mill, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Altona, Burke, Churubusco, Ellenburg Depot, Merrill, Bryants Mill, Chateaugay, Lyon Mountain, Ellenburg, Earlville, Irona, Alder Bend, Burke Center, Cannon Corners, Ellenburg Mountain, Miner Lake State Park, Harrigan, Ellenburg Center, Owls Head, and Chasm Falls. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Clinton; Northern Franklin; Southern Franklin; Western Clinton
